title: Smart Scan - Summary

body.body: After the Model and Market Variant is confirmed, the Model Status Summary page is displayed.
From this page it is possible to access the following features by clicking buttons in the top navigation menu.
The summary page displays information retrieved from the connected motorcycle. This includes the model details and the status of the motorcycle's ECMs.
Each ECM is colour coded based on its status. The colour codes are as follows:
Green - ECM up to date, No DTCs stored.
Amber - ECM up to date, DTCs stored.
Red - ECM update available, DTCs may be stored.
Red - ECM NOT CONNECTED - The tool was unable to establish communications with an expected ECM.
Grey - ECM NOT CONNECTED - The tool was unable to establish communications with an optional accessory ECM (such as the accessory My Triumph Connectivity Module).
If the diagnostic tool is unable to establish communications with an expected ECM, the affected ECM is displayed in red with the message NOT CONNECTED.
There are several reasons this can be displayed:
- The Engine Stop Switch is not in the RUN position (the Engine ECM is asleep).
- An error occurred when establishing communications.
- The ECM is unable to communicate fully due to a failed download.
- The ECM is not connected to the motorcycle harness.
Click on an ECM to expand it and view the ECM details. Details can include:
Current and expected Software and Calibration versions
The expanded ECM information also includes any actions required. Action messages can include:
Use the scroll bar on the right hand side to scroll all ECMs and ECM details.
All ECMs are highlighted green when up to date and no DTCs are stored.

body.name: Smart Scan Summary - Up To date

body.body: button will start a re-scan and refresh the motorcycle summary.
An Unlock button is available to allow convenient unlocking of new motorcycles from the Smart Scan area.
The unlock button will only be visible and accessible when a locked motorcycle is detected, and all motorcycle ECMs are up to date.
To update and unlock a new motorcycle:
Make sure the correct motorcycle Model and Market Variant details are displayed.
Navigate to the download page and update ECMs as required. (See
When all downloads are complete, the Unlock button will be visible on the Motorcycle Summary Page.
Click the unlock button and follow onscreen instructions. Enter the unlock code for your motorcycle (if required).
After the motorcycle is unlocked, navigate to the DTCS page and erase all motorcycle DTCs. See
The summary can be saved to a PDF report for viewing or printing. Click
The PDF file name is automatically generated in the following naming format:
ECMSR - DATE - TIME - VIN. For example; ECMSR 2022.06.15 - 11.47.05 (SMTTC338DDT000000).

body.name: Smart Scan Summary - Save to PDF

body.body: The saved report will automatically open in your PDF reader or browser.
Saved reports can be accessed from the diagnostic tool main menu by selecting the REPORTS menu.

search: Smart Scan - Summary
After the Model and Market Variant is confirmed, the Model Status Summary page is displayed.
From this page it is possible to access the following features by clicking buttons in the top navigation menu.
Download (see
Smart Scan - Download
DTCs (see
Smart Scan - DTCs
Main Menu (see
Smart Scan - Main Menu
The summary page displays information retrieved from the connected motorcycle. This includes the model details and the status of the motorcycle's ECMs.
Each ECM is colour coded based on its status. The colour codes are as follows:
Green - ECM up to date, No DTCs stored.
Amber - ECM up to date, DTCs stored.
Red - ECM update available, DTCs may be stored.
Red - ECM NOT CONNECTED - The tool was unable to establish communications with an expected ECM.
Grey - ECM NOT CONNECTED - The tool was unable to establish communications with an optional accessory ECM (such as the accessory My Triumph Connectivity Module).
If the diagnostic tool is unable to establish communications with an expected ECM, the affected ECM is displayed in red with the message NOT CONNECTED.
There are several reasons this can be displayed:
- The Engine Stop Switch is not in the RUN position (the Engine ECM is asleep).
- An error occurred when establishing communications.
- The ECM is unable to communicate fully due to a failed download.
- The ECM is not connected to the motorcycle harness.
- The ECM is inoperative.
Click on an ECM to expand it and view the ECM details. Details can include:
Current and expected Software and Calibration versions
Number of stored DTCs
ECM lock status.
The expanded ECM information also includes any actions required. Action messages can include:
No Action Required
Update Available
Check the stored DTCs
Unlock ECM.
Use the scroll bar on the right hand side to scroll all ECMs and ECM details.
All ECMs are highlighted green when up to date and no DTCs are stored.
Clicking the
RESCAN
button will start a re-scan and refresh the motorcycle summary.
Unlock Button
An Unlock button is available to allow convenient unlocking of new motorcycles from the Smart Scan area.
The unlock button will only be visible and accessible when a locked motorcycle is detected, and all motorcycle ECMs are up to date.
To update and unlock a new motorcycle:
Make sure the correct motorcycle Model and Market Variant details are displayed.
Navigate to the download page and update ECMs as required. (See
Smart Scan - Download
When all downloads are complete, the Unlock button will be visible on the Motorcycle Summary Page.
Click the unlock button and follow onscreen instructions. Enter the unlock code for your motorcycle (if required).
After the motorcycle is unlocked, navigate to the DTCS page and erase all motorcycle DTCs. See
Smart Scan - DTCs
Model Status Summary PDF Report
The summary can be saved to a PDF report for viewing or printing. Click
SAVE TO PDF
to save a report.
The PDF file name is automatically generated in the following naming format:
ECMSR - DATE - TIME - VIN. For example; ECMSR 2022.06.15 - 11.47.05 (SMTTC338DDT000000).
Click
Save
to save the report.
The saved report will automatically open in your PDF reader or browser.
Saved reports can be accessed from the diagnostic tool main menu by selecting the REPORTS menu.
